intro: Parodia fuscatoviridis, commonly known as the Greenish Cactus or the Black-Furred Pincushion, is a species of cactus native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, cylindrical stems covered in short, dark green to black spines. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, adding a striking contrast to its dark foliage. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
